intro: Styphelia exolasia, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is an evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Styphelia exolasia thrives in sandy soils and is often found in heathland and coastal scrub environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for cultivation in gardens with well-drained soil.
